memberdef.argsstring: (cublasHandle_t cublas_handle, const DataType *A, const DataType *b, const LongIndexType num_rows, const LongIndexType num_columns, const FlagType A_is_row_major, DataType *c)
memberdef.name: dense_matvec

briefdescription.para: Computes the matrix vector multiplication $ \boldsymbol{c} = \mathbf{A} \boldsymbol{b} $ where $ \mathbf{A} $ is a dense matrix.

parameterdescription.para: The cuBLAS object handle.
1D array that represents a 2D dense array with either C (row) major ordering or Fortran (column) major ordering. The major ordering should de defined by A_is_row_major flag.
Column vector
Number of rows of A
Number of columns of A

Boolean, can be 0 or 1 as follows:
If A is row major (C ordering where the last index is contiguous) this value should be 1.
If A is column major (Fortran ordering where the first index is contiguous), this value should be set to 0.
The output column vector (written in-place).

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasHandle_t cublas_handle, const DataType *A, const DataType *b, const DataType alpha, const LongIndexType num_rows, const LongIndexType num_columns, const FlagType A_is_row_major, DataType *c)
memberdef.name: dense_matvec_plus

briefdescription.para: Computes the operation $ \boldsymbol{c} = \boldsymbol{c} + \alpha \mathbf{A} \boldsymbol{b} $ where $ \mathbf{A} $ is a dense matrix.

parameterdescription.para: The cuBLAS object handle.
1D array that represents a 2D dense array with either C (row) major ordering or Fortran (column) major ordering. The major ordering should de defined by A_is_row_major flag.
Column vector
A scalar that scales the matrix vector multiplication.
Number of rows of A
Number of columns of A

Boolean, can be 0 or 1 as follows:
If A is row major (C ordering where the last index is contiguous) this value should be 1.
If A is column major (Fortran ordering where the first index is contiguous), this value should be set to 0.
The output column vector (written in-place).

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasHandle_t cublas_handle, const DataType *A, const DataType *b, const LongIndexType num_rows, const LongIndexType num_columns, const FlagType A_is_row_major, DataType *c)
memberdef.name: dense_transposed_matvec

briefdescription.para: Computes matrix vector multiplication $\boldsymbol{c} = \mathbf{A}^{\intercal} \boldsymbol{b} $ where $ \mathbf{A} $ is dense, and $ \mathbf{A}^{\intercal} $ is the transpose of the matrix $ \mathbf{A} $.

parameterdescription.para: The cuBLAS object handle.
1D array that represents a 2D dense array with either C (row) major ordering or Fortran (column) major ordering. The major ordering should de defined by A_is_row_major flag.
Column vector
Number of rows of A
Number of columns of A

Boolean, can be 0 or 1 as follows:
If A is row major (C ordering where the last index is contiguous) this value should be 1.
f A is column major (Fortran ordering where the first index is contiguous), this value should be set to 0.
The output column vector (written in-place).

memberdef.argsstring: (cublasHandle_t cublas_handle, const DataType *A, const DataType *b, const DataType alpha, const LongIndexType num_rows, const LongIndexType num_columns, const FlagType A_is_row_major, DataType *c)
memberdef.name: dense_transposed_matvec_plus

briefdescription.para: Computes $ \boldsymbol{c} = \boldsymbol{c} + \alpha \mathbf{A}^{\intercal} \boldsymbol{b} $ where $ \mathbf{A} $ is dense, and $ \mathbf{A}^{\intercal} $ is the transpose of the matrix $ \mathbf{A} $.

parameterdescription.para: The cuBLAS object handle.
1D array that represents a 2D dense array with either C (row) major ordering or Fortran (column) major ordering. The major ordering should de defined by A_is_row_major flag.
Column vector
A scalar that scales the matrix vector multiplication.
Number of rows of A
Number of columns of A

Boolean, can be 0 or 1 as follows:
If A is row major (C ordering where the last index is contiguous) this value should be 1.
f A is column major (Fortran ordering where the first index is contiguous), this value should be set to 0.
The output column vector (written in-place).

memberdef.argsstring: (cusparseHandle_t cusparse_handle, const DataType *A_data, const LongIndexType *A_column_indices, const LongIndexType *A_index_pointer, const DataType *b, const LongIndexType num_rows, DataType *c)
memberdef.name: csr_matvec

briefdescription.para: Computes $ \boldsymbol{c} = \mathbf{A} \boldsymbol{b} $ where $ \mathbf{A} $ is compressed sparse row (CSR) matrix and $ \boldsymbol{b} $ is a dense vector. The output $ \boldsymbol{c} $ is a dense vector.

parameterdescription.para: The cuSparse object handle.
CSR format data array of the sparse matrix. The length of this array is the nnz of the matrix.
CSR format column indices of the sparse matrix. The length of this array is the nnz of the matrix.
CSR format index pointer. The length of this array is one plus the number of rows of the matrix. Also, the first element of this array is 0, and the last element is the nnz of the matrix.
Column vector with same size of the number of columns of A.
Number of rows of the matrix A. This is essentially the size of A_index_pointer array minus one.
Output column vector with the same size as b. This array is written in-place.

memberdef.argsstring: (cusparseHandle_t cusparse_handle, const DataType *A_data, const LongIndexType *A_column_indices, const LongIndexType *A_index_pointer, const DataType *b, const DataType alpha, const LongIndexType num_rows, DataType *c)
memberdef.name: csr_matvec_plus

briefdescription.para: Computes $ \boldsymbol{c} = \boldsymbol{c} + \alpha \mathbf{A} \boldsymbol{b} $ where $ \mathbf{A} $ is compressed sparse row (CSR) matrix and $ \boldsymbol{b} $ is a dense vector. The output $ \boldsymbol{c} $ is a dense vector.

parameterdescription.para: The cuSparse object handle.
CSR format data array of the sparse matrix. The length of this array is the nnz of the matrix.

CSR format index pointer. The length of this array is one plus the number of rows of the matrix. Also, the first element of this array is 0, and the last element is the nnz of the matrix.
Column vector with same size of the number of columns of A.
A scalar that scales the matrix vector multiplication.
Number of rows of the matrix A. This is essentially the size of A_index_pointer array minus one.
Output column vector with the same size as b. This array is written in-place.

memberdef.argsstring: (cusparseHandle_t cublas_handle, const DataType *diagonals, const DataType *supdiagonals, const IndexType non_zero_size, const FlagType tridiagonal, DataType **matrix)
memberdef.name: create_band_matrix

briefdescription.para: Creates bi-diagonal or symmetric tri-diagonal matrix from the diagonal array (diagonals) and off-diagonal array (supdiagonals).

detaileddescription.para: The output is written in place (in matrix). The output is only written up to the non_zero_size element, that is: matrix[:non_zero_size,:non_zero_size] is filled, and the rest is assumed to be zero.
Depending on tridiagonal, the matrix is upper bi-diagonal or symmetric tri-diagonal.

parameterdescription.para: The cuSparse object handle.
An array of length n. All elements diagonals create the diagonals of matrix.

An array of length n. Elements supdiagonals[0:-1] create the upper off-diagonal of matrix, making matrix an upper bi-diagonal matrix. In addition, if tridiagonal is set to 1, the lower off-diagonal is also created similar to the upper off-diagonal, making matrix a symmetric tri-diagonal matrix.

Up to the matrix[:non_zero_size,:non_zero_size] of matrix will be written. At most, non_zero_size can be n, which is the size of diagonals array and the size of the square matrix. If non_zero_size is less than n, it is due to the fact that either diagonals or supdiagonals has zero elements after the size element (possibly due to early termination of Lanczos iterations method).
Boolean. If set to 0, the matrix T becomes upper bi-diagonal. If set to 1, the matrix becomes symmetric tri-diagonal.
A 2D matrix (written in place) of the shape (n,n). This is the output of this function. This matrix is assumed to be initialized to zero before calling this function.

briefdescription.para: A static class for matrix-vector operations, which are similar to the level-2 operations of the BLAS library. This class acts as a templated namespace, where all member methods are public and static.

detaileddescription.para: This class implements matrix-vector multiplication for three types of matrices:

listitem.para: Dense matrix (both row major and column major)

detaileddescription.para: For each of the above matrix types, there are four kinds of matrix vector multiplications implemented.
